name: HD 147873
scenarioDescription:
The HD 147873 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 147873 is a star with 1.38 times the mass of the Sun, and 2.29 times its radius. It is located 356.75 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 147873 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 147873 system


HD 147873 b

HD 147873 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.52 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 147873 b is 1634.52 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 147873 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 147873 c

HD 147873 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 147873 c is 731.4 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 147873 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 147873, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
